skill.description: Use when creating new skills, editing existing skills, or verifying skills work before deployment
skill.summary: Use when creating new skills, editing existing skills, or verifying skills work before deployment
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-focused skill with one helper script that renders Graphviz diagrams to SVG. All capabilities align with stated purpose. No network access, no credential handling, no data exfiltration.

low_findings.title: Script executes external command
low_findings.description: render-graphs.js uses execSync to run 'dot -Tsvg' (graphviz renderer) and 'which dot' (command availability check). This is necessary for the documented purpose of rendering flowchart diagrams from skill documentation. The script only writes to a 'diagrams' subdirectory within the skill directory.

content.user_title: Create and test AI skills with TDD
content.value_statement: Skills fail when not tested under pressure. This skill applies test-driven development to skill authoring, teaching you to verify skills work before deployment and close rationalization loopholes before users encounter them.
actual_capabilities: Apply RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle to skill creation
Create pressure scenarios that test skill compliance
Document agent rationalizations and close loopholes
Write skills that resist rationalization under pressure
limitations: Does not install or configure Claude Code itself
Does not write code to user projects without explicit prompts
Graphviz renderer requires graphviz to be installed separately
Does not provide pre-built skills or templates

use_cases.title: Create verifiable skills
use_cases.description: Document proven techniques so future Claude instances find and apply them correctly

use_cases.title: Standardize documentation
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill authoring practices across your organization

use_cases.title: Refine existing skills
use_cases.description: Test deployed skills under pressure and close rationalization loopholes

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Document a technique you use frequently
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-skills to create a skill for [technique name]. Apply TDD: first run baseline scenarios WITHOUT the skill to see how agents fail, then write skill content that addresses those failures.

prompt_templates.title: Test existing skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Verify a skill works under pressure
prompt_templates.prompt: Use testing-skills-with-subagents to test the [skill-name] skill. Create 3+ pressure scenarios combining time pressure, sunk cost, and authority. Document exact rationalizations.

prompt_templates.title: Close loopholes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-skills to refactor the [skill-name] skill. Agent rationalized by [specific excuse]. Add explicit counter with no exceptions rule and update rationalization table.

prompt_templates.title: Add flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Graphviz flowchart showing [decision process] using the graphviz-conventions.dot style. Render it using render-graphs.js to SVG for documentation.

output_examples.input: Create a skill for handling async race conditions in tests
output: 1. Write failing test: Run scenario WITHOUT skill to capture baseline behavior
2. Document failures: Note exactly how agent fails and rationalizes
3. Write skill: Address specific failures with concrete counters
4. Verify: Re-run scenarios WITH skill, apply 3+ pressures
5. Refactor: Add explicit anti-rationalization rules and rationalization table

best_practices: Always test skills under combined pressures (time + sunk cost + exhaustion) before deploying
Write skill content BEFORE testing - the iron law: no skill without a failing test first
Close loopholes explicitly: forbid specific workarounds, do not just state rules
anti_patterns: Writing skill content before running baseline scenarios (skips RED phase)
Using single-pressure tests (agents resist single pressure, break under multiple)
Vague skill descriptions that summarize workflow instead of listing triggering conditions

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. Skills work with both platforms. Test with all models you plan to use.

faq.question: What is the file size limit for skills?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines. Split heavy reference material into separate files.

faq.question: Can I reference other skills from my skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Use REQUIRED SUB-SKILL or REQUIRED BACKGROUND markers to link related skills.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Skills only read documentation files. Helper scripts write to skill subdirectories only.

faq.question: Why do skills need pressure testing?
faq.answer: Agents under pressure find loopholes. Pressure scenarios reveal rationalizations to close.

faq.question: How is this different from writing code documentation?
faq.answer: Skills must resist rationalization. TDD for documentation ensures agents follow rules under pressure.
